50.description: This is the lightest shade of the color and can be used as a background color for sections or containers in a design. It could also be used as a subtle highlight or border color for elements that need to stand out without being too attention-grabbing.

100.description: This is a slightly darker shade than value 50 and can be used as a background color for cards, panels, or other UI elements. It could also be used for typography or icons to create contrast against a lighter background.

200.description: This shade is a bit darker than value 100 and could be used as a background color for larger UI elements like modals or popovers. It could also be used for larger typography or headings to create contrast against a lighter background.

300.description: This is a medium shade of the color and could be used as a background color for smaller UI elements like buttons or form fields. It could also be used as a text color for body copy or other smaller typography.

400.description: This is a brighter, more saturated shade of the color and could be used as an accent color for buttons, links, or other interactive elements. It could also be used as a background color for icons or other small UI elements.

500.description: This is a darker shade than value 400 and could be used as a hover or active state for buttons or other interactive elements. It could also be used as a background color for smaller popovers or dropdown menus.

600.description: This is a darker shade than value 500 and could be used as a background color for larger popovers or dropdown menus. It could also be used as a text color for headings or other larger typography.

700.description: This is a very dark shade of the color and could be used as a background color for modals or other larger UI elements. It could also be used as a text color for headings or other larger typography.

800.description: This is the second darkest shade and could be used as a border color or text color for smaller UI elements like buttons or form fields. It could also be used as a background color for icons or other small UI elements.

900.description: This is the darkest shade of the color and could be used as a background color for smaller text elements like tooltips or captions. It could also be used as a text color for headings or other larger typography to create contrast against a lighter background.

100.description: This is a variation of the new primary  color. This is a deeper variant of the primary (retro color).
